keyword: how many calories is in a rotisserie chicken
title: How Many Calories in a Rotisserie Chicken?
meta_description: Learn how many calories is in a rotisserie chicken—about 2200 kcal for a whole average bird—plus protein, fat, sodium, and tweaks for skinless or sauced versions.
h1: How Many Calories in a Rotisserie Chicken?
assumptions: Whole average rotisserie chicken (~1200 g edible meat and skin), roasted with mild seasoning, no added sauces or sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, brand, seasoning, cooking method, and portion (e.g., meat only vs. with skin). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A whole rotisserie chicken provides ~2200 kcal, with high protein (~288 g) and moderate fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories is in a rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 2200 kcal for a whole average rotisserie chicken with skin.

faqs.q: How much protein in a whole rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: About 288 g of protein, making it a great lean protein source.
Typically 0 g carbs, as it's plain roasted meat and skin.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Due to seasoning and brining; one whole chicken has ~4800 mg sodium.

faqs.q: Calories in half a rotisserie chicken?
faqs.a: Around 1100 kcal for half, depending on even division of meat and skin.
